intro: Baeriopsis guadalupensis, commonly known as the Guadalupe baeriopsis, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Chihuahuan Desert in Mexico. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments. The plant features simple, linear leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually green or pale yellow. Its botanical significance lies in its limited distribution and potential ecological role in its native habitat. Due to habitat loss and environmental changes, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
